Message.Title: MSFT rallied 20% to ~33 Jan12 and Feb12: Here are the facts
Message.Msg: 1. MSFT returned 33% on invested capital on share 10 years ago to today if people include dividends. A lot more if people factor in share buyback 2. Currently MSFT trades at 8times forward PE of 3.35 and 6 times net of cash 3. MSFT had 31Billion in cash flow in FY12 and likely will go up to 35Billion this year 4. Android sales help MSFT (1Bilion+ per year) because Android uses MSFT patents 5. Windows dvisions will show great growthin 2013. See comments from DELL, Lenovo on touch Win8 6. At 3.35 CY13 EPS, as market pays more normal S&P like PE of 15 TTM PE, MSFT can hit 50

Message.Title: Microsoft Is Fast Turning Into A Sideshow
Message.Msg: Google it.... This is Forbes speaking, and Forbes, despite the wallybot, is not an "anit-Microsoft rag". "So, now it’s clear: Windows 8 did not blow the doors off during the holiday. In context, this tepid launch is just one of a litany of failures fast relegating Microsoft to the status of incidental spectacle in the information technology business. "If Windows 8 is Exhibit A, Exhibit B is Windows Phone 8. Nokia has started discounting recently launched Lumia phones, indicating that they’re not exactly moving like hotcakes. Microsoft makes excuses and says these things take time, but even a fool can tell a torrid introduction from a lukewarm launch. "Thus, in the important high-mobility category (phones and tablets), where Apple and Google are cleaning up, Microsoft is 0 for 2. "More on how bad it is: An in-depth review of Windows 8 by Brian Boyko pans Windows 8 for nearly 24 minutes." ....

Message.Title: Windows8 may be selling really well: Net Applications Data. 1.64% of 1.5Billion installed base of PCs?
Message.Msg: Windows 8 Grab 1.64%, Windows 7 Pass 45%, Vista Down To 5.67%, XP Fell To 39.08% Posted on Jan 2 2013 - 10:27am by Karan Chopra « PREVIOUS | Categorized as Apps & Software 13 Tagged as VistaWindowsWindows 7Windows 8Windows VistaWindows XPXP Related Tips To Convert WMV To iPad Microsoft Releases Security Advisory 2794220, Confirms New IE Vulnerability (Updated) Distimo: Apple App Store Downloads Counts A 87% High On Christmas Day 2012 With Revenues Increased 70% It would be a great start for Windows as its market share finally gained after six months of decline with Windows 8 grabbed 1.64%, and Windows 7 passed 45%. According to the latest market share data from Net Applications, in the month of December 2012, Windows 8 gained 0.55 percentages of points, from 1.09 percent to 1.64 percent. Windows Market Share On the other end, Windows 7 gained 0.40 percentage points, from 44.71 percent to 45.11 percent while Windows Vista down 0.03 percentage points, from 5.70 percent to 5.67 percent with Windows XP fell a huge 0.74 percentage points, from 39.82 percent to 39.08 percent. The data comes from 160 million unique per month as the service monitors some 40,000 websites for its clients.

Topic.Title: My prediction of a MSFT double....

Message.Msg: I somewhat agree with you that msft stock cycles between 24-33 range; history for the last 10 years shows that. However, msft has also been safe and idling for the last decade. They made profits with their dominence in software, but only until now that they venture into Hardware. Windows 8 is different from other windows versions because it allows collaboration of touchpads to PC's-- allmost nearly as important as discovering the first software. Thus, it will revive the slump in PC business and allows more gaming in touchpads/laptops. On one hand, it doesn't hurt to buy in at 27 and if it cycles back to 33, you will still profit. If msft takes off because of Window 8 and surface, then you will double and triple your equity. Which ever way you look at it, it is a strong buy at these levels.
